lexUnit.name: lean.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person) thin, especially healthily so

sentence.text: The second man , who was tall and lean , came running from the glade in which the car was parked .
When we first met , Ryan was lean and mean .
If you are tall and lean , so should your drawn image be ; all this will help you to feel more intimately involved with the figure you are drawing .
If one parent is obese , 40 per cent of the children will be obese , and if both parents are lean , then only 10 per cent will be obese .
Laidlaw had always been the unit 's fitness fanatic , pushing himself to the limit to keep his lean , muscular body in shape .
I can still picture him as I knew him , his sensitive , ascetic face etched with lines of pain but lit by his innate kindliness , his lean body in comfortable country tweeds .
And his lean , strong body with its broad shoulders , tapering waist , narrow hips and long muscular legs exuded a virile , potent energy that seemed to crackle almost audibly .

He was dressed formally , in a dark dinner suit that emphasise the width of his shoulders and the whipcord hardness of his lean body , his dark Roman head inclined slightly towards the woman standing beside him .
A tall lean figure with deep lines carved vertically down his brown cheeks , he came into the office looking as cool as he did on a winter 's day .
Mr Bragg nodded towards a lean figure picking his way towards them among the splintered remains of the wooden rollers .
In Haiti , the voodoo island of the West Indies , this god of death appears as a lean figure in black top hat , long black tailcoat and dark glasses .
She recognised the lean figure of Richard Blake moving towards the exhibition stand , and the last thing she wanted right now was for him to notice her .
Ectomorphs can look deceptively fit by virtue of their lean frame and are often agile movers .
He was standing in the doorway , his lean frame clad in a loose-fitting tawny-coloured suit that seemed to emphasise the taut muscle that lay beneath it .
After a short while she saw him emerge on to the quayside , a tall , lean man with the kind of rangy , loose-limbed walk which drew admiring glances from any female within range .
When Richard had gone she sat watching the other guests ; Stella was chatting animatedly to a lean , grey-haired man .
When he found his friends , he saw that a lean white man had joined them .
The conversation was interrupted by the appearance of Florrie Axford , a tall , lean woman in her early fifties .
Both underweight and overweight women had a lower chance of becoming pregnant than women with normal weight , although this effect was greater for the obese than for the lean women .

However , this explanation does not hold for our results because most of the lean women in our population had regular cycles with biphasic basal body temperatures and did not require induction of ovulation .
